definition.name: NXbeam
definition.doc:
Properties of the neutron or X-ray beam at a given location.
It will be referenced by beamline component groups within the :ref:`NXinstrument` group or by the :ref:`NXsample` group. Note that variables such as the incident energy could be scalar values or arrays. This group is especially valuable in storing the results of instrument simulations in which it is useful to specify the beam profile, time distribution etc. at each beamline component. Otherwise, its most likely use is in the :ref:`NXsample` group in which it defines the results of the neutron scattering by the sample, e.g., energy transfer, polarizations.

field.name: energy_transfer
field.doc: Energy change caused by beamline component

field.name: incident_wavelength_spread
field.doc: Wavelength spread FWHM on entering component

field.name: incident_beam_divergence
field.doc: Divergence of beam entering this component

field.name: extent

field.name: incident_polarization
field.doc: Polarization vector on entering beamline component

field.name: final_polarization
field.doc: Polarization vector on leaving beamline component

field.name: final_wavelength_spread
field.doc: Wavelength spread FWHM of beam leaving this component

field.name: final_beam_divergence
field.doc: Divergence FWHM of beam leaving this component

field.name: flux
field.doc: flux incident on beam plane area

group.doc: Distribution of beam with respect to relevant variable e.g. wavelength. This is mainly useful for simulations which need to store plottable information at each beamline component.

attribute.name: default
attribute.doc:
.. index:: plotting
Declares which child group contains a path leading to a :ref:`NXdata` group.
It is recommended (as of NIAC2014) to use this attribute to help define the path to the default dataset to be plotted. See https://www.nexusformat.org/2014_How_to_find_default_data.html for a summary of the discussion.
